intro: Hastingsia alba, commonly known as the silverleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silvery-white leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes other species of buckwheat. Hastingsia alba is often found in dry slopes and rocky areas, making it a hardy and resilient species.
